intro: Chrysosplenium jienningense, commonly known as the Jienning golden spleenwort, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its botanical features include a short stem, alternate leaves, and small white or greenish flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
